div.aria-label: Environmental Art Sculptures by Eastchester District Website Administrator

img.alt: Picture of Eastchester District Website Administrator
img.title: Picture of Eastchester District Website Administrator

div.p: Let’s go outdoors and view environmental art sculptures created by students in Nicole Reardon’s and Sarah Simeone’s classes.
The Eastchester Middle School students have been working on the pieces during the closure. The project is based on the art of Andy Goldsworthy.

“Research has shown that art affects our fundamental sense of self. In today's time, art can allow us to express our feelings, work together creatively and find inner peace,” said Simeone. “Now, more than ever it's invaluable for students to have an outlet for themselves and continue the creative process."
This artwork represents students from sixth through eighth grades and is just one of the many assignments they are conducting weekly through Google Classroom.

div.div: View the discussion (0 replies so far)

div.aria-label: Eastchester High School Players Club Virtual Performance by Grace Noone

div.div: Eastchester High School Players Club Virtual Performance

div.p: Like clockwork, every day at 3 pm, Eastchester High School students gather to rehearse for the spring musical, Urinetown. What sets this gathering apart from your typical high school play practice is that for weeks the cast has met virtually.

"It is a good way for us to maintain some normalcy and to have a bit of hope and remember that everyone still has the same connection to each other. We can get through this all together," said senior Shannon Pepper, who plays Little Sally in the cast.
Director John Gwardyak agreed. "Rehearsal is our constant. If I am in ANY way helping the students get through this crisis, it's a two-way street. This is the only time during the day ...
